text: Pass through the Artisanship Commission's shortcut and head to the Alchemy Commission

title: Mission Description
content: The storm calms in the Artisanship Commission and the shortcut also opens up. You should pass through here as per thegeneral's recommendations and head to the Alchemy Commission.

text: (Trailblazer, March 7th, Tingyun, and Welt observe their surroundings)

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Whoa, looks like the battle here was intense...

speaker: Tingyun
line: The master diviner must have launched the campaign while we were delayed in the Artisanship Commission.

text: She must have divined it was the right time.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Time is of the essence. The most important task for the Xianzhou Luofu is suppressing the Stellaron .

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: General Jing Yuan tasked the master diviner with commanding the Cloud Knights — he would've known she'd act on the results of her divination.

text: I can't imagine Fu Xuan obeying orders to the word.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Indeed. Since General Jing Yuan tasked the master diviner with commanding the Cloud Knights, he must've known she'd act on the results of her divination.

speaker: March 7th
line: Thank goodness the general didn't make us go with the Knights... Fighting is totally different from adventuring. All these people... I—It's tough to bear.

speaker: Tingyun
line: I'm afraid this is nothing, benefactor...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Centuries ago, an Emanator of Abundance besieged the Luofu with the aim of taking the Ambrosial Arbor . They destroyed half our delves and killed most of the Cloud Knights.

speaker: Tingyun
line: For long-life species , such events are more like yesterday's memories than ancient history. This awful spectacle is child's play in comparison.

speaker: March 7th
line: Hey, is that supposed to make us feel better!?

speaker: Welt
line: It's hard to tell if the master diviner won or lost here.

text: I think she won total victory!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I think so too! I can't see many Cloud Knights — the Xianzhou must have fought well!

text: Seems to me, her troops were wiped out...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Hey, whose side are you on!? I can't see many Cloud Knights — the Xianzhou must have fought well!

text: Let's play it safe and say it was a draw.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...A draw? This isn't a tournament, y'know! I can't see many Cloud Knights — the Xianzhou must have fought well!

speaker: Welt
line: ...Not necessarily. There'd usually be a base with supporting forces set up after a successful engagement, but we don't see any of that.

speaker: Welt
line: Let's look around and see if we can find some clues.

title: Step Description
content: The Alchemy Commission lies in total chaos with a large-scale skirmish just kicking off. Just as you plan to stay away and assess the situation, you hear the sound of survivors calling for help.

text: On the monster's rigid body, several conspicuous wounds are shrinking at a speed discernible to the naked eye. Despite the absence of any vital signs, you sense that the monster in front of you is not completely dead.

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Be careful, (Trailblazer). Those monsters are pretty tough...

speaker: March 7th
line: Look, there's someone over there!

speaker: Cloud Knight
line: Agh...

speaker: Woman
line: Don't move. Let me have a look...

speaker: March 7th
line: Here! There are still survivors here...

speaker: Woman in Healer Dress
line: Hmm? You're not the Knights... What is your purpose here? It's dangerous.

speaker: Welt
line: We're reinforcements sent by the general. Where's everyone else?

speaker: Woman in Healer Dress
line: Tsk, resorting to short-life species as reinforcements... Hehe, Jing Yuan is truly running out of options.

speaker: Dying Cloud Knight
line: Run! She's... a Disciple of Sanctus Medicus!

speaker: Woman in Healer Dress
line: Silence. If my healing worked, you'll become one of us...

speaker: Woman in Healer Dress
line: ...and then it's not just me they'll be running from.

speaker: Dying Cloud Knight
line: Hurry... leave here...

speaker: Dying Cloud Knight
line: I can't control myself anymore...

text: (Wave 2:Abundance Sprite: Wooden Lupus×2,Abundance Sprite: Golden Hound×1)

speaker: Disciple of Sanctus Medicus
line: The lives of short-life species are so fleetingly brief. Why seek death?

text: (Wave 3:Abundance Sprite: Golden Hound×1,Disciples of Sanctus Medicus: Ballistarius×1,Abundance Sprite: Wooden Lupus×1)

speaker: Disciple of Sanctus Medicus
line: Why did you come to the Xianzhou? To seek immortality?

speaker: Disciple of Sanctus Medicus
line: You don't have to appease Jing Yuan! The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus can provide all that you desire!

speaker: March 7th
line: H—Hold on! We'll find someone to help...

speaker: Dying Cloud Knight
line: Don't waste your time. They've "converted" me. I don't have much longer...

speaker: Dying Cloud Knight
line: Go... The master diviner's troops are ahead...

text: He stops talking. It could be because he is exhausted, or he's waiting for you to leave him be.

speaker: Welt
line: ...Let's go.

text: Join up with the Cloud Knights commanded by Fu Xuan

title: Step Description
content: According to the survivors, the master diviner had led the army to attack the rebel forces made up of Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. Your most urgent task right now is to head to the Knights' encampment and meet up with them.

speaker: Tingyun
line: The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus were in hiding for so long... now they finally show their face. Did the master diviner fail to foresee this...?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Be careful, benefactors. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus worship Yaoshi the Plagues Author — the greatest enemy of the Xianzhou.

speaker: Tingyun
line: The Alliance has been trying to root out their secret organization for millennia — it's no coincidence that they've chosen this moment to reveal themselves.

text: Its armor is covered in sword marks. But the strange thing is that these marks all came from the deceased's own weapon.
A huge, wolf-life beast lies on the ground. Its corpse shows no signs of life, but tiny saplings are sprouting from underneath it.
(Investigate Cloud Knight on the ground, optional)
Removing the helmet, you look straight into the face of the fallen Cloud Knight.

An expression of agony is frozen on the face of this Xianzhou man of indiscernible age. You find a cluster of mutated branches at the temples of his hair — he seems to have been subjected to purgatory-like torture before his death.
A painful moan amidst the ravaged battlefield draws your attention.

speaker: Injured Cloud Knight
line: Reignbow's blessing... You're not Disciples of Sanctus Medicus...

speaker: March 7th
line: Stop moving around! Let's see if there's a way to help you recover faster.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Come on, take this. It'll help with your injuries.

children.text: (Submit item prompt for at least one of the following: Simple First-Aid Device, Steamed Puffergoat Milk, Life Transmitter, Stone-Grilled Olm)
You fumble through your bag to find medicine for her wounds and administer it one drop at a time.
For a moment you are worried that medicine made for ordinary humans might not work on long-life species.

children.speaker: The Cloud Knight propped herself so she could stand.
Recovered Cloud Knight
children.line: ...Th—Thank you, all of you. I feel much better now.

children.speaker: Recovered Cloud Knight
children.line: Thank goodness you're here... The garrison is up ahead, are you heading there now? I'll wait there for you.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Don't we have anything to help her?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Uhh, you wait here. I'm gonna get your comrades to help you.

children.speaker: Injured Cloud Knight
children.line: Just leave me...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Don't we have anything to help her?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Uhh, you wait here. I'm gonna get your comrades to help you.

children.speaker: Injured Cloud Knight
children.line: Just leave me...

text: (Upon attempting to go past left Cloud Knight Guard)

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: There are Sanctus Medicus sorcerers hiding out there — it's too dangerous to roam. Please wait here for the master diviner's return.

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: Who goes there? Show yourselves!

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: Wait, it's you...! Quickly, in here! It's dangerous outside.

speaker: March 7th
line: You recognize us?

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: Are you not the general's guests? The master diviner prophesied your arrival — we were ordered to wait for you under any circumstances.

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: Yes. The master diviner ordered us to remain stationed here and went to scout ahead. They're saying the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus have returned — they haven't been seen for an age... The troops are anxious.

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: It's good that you're here — the master diviner said the Knights weren't to move out until you arrived.

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: Please wait in the camp — we'll decide on our next steps once the master diviner returns.

speaker: Welt
line: That the Cloud Knights received orders not to advance is a bad sign. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus... I've heard the name before. If memory serves, they're an underground sect of the Abundance that's said to have lain dormant within the Xianzhou, plotting to overthrow the Alliance...

speaker: Welt
line: The Stellaron has certainly caused Abundance-like abnormalities — is that what motivated the Disciples to come out of the shadows? No. The Knight's main force remains intact... Something must have happened — something we're not aware of. The master diviner isn't here — let's head into camp and see what we can learn from the troops here.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Good idea, why don't you take a look around, benefactors? My feet need a rest.

text: Get information on the outcome of the fighting and wait for Fu Xuan to return

title: Step Description
content: The Cloud Knights are stationed temporarily in a market in the Alchemy Commission. You learn that Fu Xuan had left with the scouts to assess the enemy.All you can do for now is wait... or talk with the Knights to find out about the fighting so far.

text:
(Talk to Tingyun, optional)
(Before talking to Captured Disciple)

speaker: Tingyun
line: Have you talked with these Disciples, benefactor? What do you make of them?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Why would they betray the Luofu... I don't understand.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Have you talked with these Disciples, benefactor? What do you make of them?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: True. But in the eyes of the Denizens of Abundance ...

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: ...ignoring the true nature of long-life species, suppressing the inner mara , maintaining the facade of mortal society... it's a child's game. Another breed of madness, perhaps.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: They brought this upon themselves. The Xianzhou Alliance forbids anyone from accessing forbidden knowledge regarding immortality.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: They should have thought about whether they were capable of paying the price when seeking the power of an Aeon .

text: I can understand their desire for knowledge...

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Shh, that's a brave thing to say out in the open... If the Cloud Knights hear you, they won't think twice.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Hehe, it strikes me that you'd use any means to achieve your goal, benefactor.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Xianzhou natives are more afraid of immortality than they are of the days coming to an end.

speaker: Tingyun
line: They received eternal life as they had desired, but are doomed to a fate more terrifying than death. The Abundance played a cruel trick on them.

speaker: Shocked Cloud Knight
line: It was so close... so close...!

speaker: Shocked Cloud Knight
line: Even seasoned soldiers — soldiers of three centuries were turned into... twisted beings! I was almost... almost...

speaker: Sky-Faring Commission Foxian
line: The Cloud Knights undergo such thorough training. How could they lose control like this?

speaker: Sky-Faring Commission Foxian
line: It's one thing for humans to be stricken with mara. But foxians and Vidyadhara ...?

speaker: Nervous Cloud Knight
line: But this is different from all our previous battles! Captain, even our own comrades may become our enemies this time...

speaker: Cloud Knight Captain
line: Every Cloud Knight knows what they must do if their comrades become mara-struck. Don't forget your training.

speaker: Nervous Cloud Knight
line: B—But this shouldn't be happening! We're still so young — we're not old enough to be stricken with mara yet...

speaker: Cloud Knight Captain
line: There are records of such a phenomenon in the Cloud Knights Martial Doctrine. Those who come into contact with the Plagues Author become mara-struck instantly... I never thought the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus were real, or so close to us.

speaker: Nervous Cloud Knight
line: I—I don't know how many more of our soldiers will...

speaker: Dispirited Cloud Knight
line: I just felt there were... enemies all around me. I only felt hatred. I wanted to kill everything in my path...

speaker: Mumbling Cloud Knight
line: Disciples of Sanctus Medicus... who would have thought our enemies would turn out to be the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus...

speaker: Mumbling Cloud Knight
line: *sigh* The master diviner must have kept it quiet to avoid alerting them.

speaker: Aurumaton Guard
line: Command Talisman required for operation...

speaker: March 7th
line: What does it mean?

speaker: Welt
line: We probably need to present it with a command for it to act.

text: The Cloud Knights are guarding a prisoner who is murmuring to himself.

speaker: Deranged Disciple
line: I... saw it... I saw myself become thunder... become a storm...

speaker: Deranged Disciple
line: That scent in the elixir crucible... I could smell the future...

speaker: Deranged Disciple
line: Mere flesh will not trap me... I am the Ebon Deer. I see the leaves and branches covering the sky. I will change again...

speaker: Cloud Knight Guarding Prisoners
line: We captured a few devils from the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. Some of them are already mad, and this one is the maddest.

text: The alchemist's eyes were unfocused, darting back and forth, as if he were looking at the two diverging ends of a path.
(Upon trying to leave to the north)

speaker: Cloud Knight Guard
line: The master diviner has gone ahead with the scouts. Please wait here for her.

text: (Upon trying to leave to the south)

speaker: Alarmed Cloud Knight
line: Sorry, I didn't want to stop the general's distinguished guests, but just to warn you, there have been some dangerous sightings ahead. For your own safety, please stay in the areas guarded by the Cloud Knights.

text: A Cloud Knight is standing next to the captive. He steps aside after you explain your identity and show him the general's order.

speaker: Alarmed Cloud Knight
line: You want to ask questions? Fine, but I must be present the whole way through. This part needs to be recorded as testimony.

speaker: Captured Disciple
line: ...Finally someone to talk to. These Cloud Knights are so serious, so boring, hehe...

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: That shining seed? Haha, I've seen it, so beautiful. If you gaze into it, there's a voice inside that speaks to you...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer)... do you still remember Cocolia ?

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: The master said we could inject new life into the Ambrosial Arbor with it. Hehe, I didn't believe it at first.

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: We tried many methods, spending multiple lifetimes of short-life species, yet the Arbor showed no signs of resurrection.

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: But look upon it now, hehe — "only the power of an Aeon can recreate the miracle." Yes, yes, the mighty Sanctus Medicus ! The Abundance!

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: So you witnessed it too? The Ambrosial Arbor's resurrection, hehe... Magnificent!

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: In the befall era , so far in the past that even long-life species cannot recall, Sanctus Medicus the Abundance gifted the Ambrosial Arbor to the Xianzhou Luofu. With that sacred tree, humanity realized many miracles: The fallow earth , the western soapberry, the altered flesh...

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: But that Devilish Archer ruined everything! They twisted right and wrong and erased Sanctus Medicus's achievements... But soon... soon we will return to the glory of the befall era !

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: You've seen the fantastic creatures that fought with us? They are only minor gifts of the Ambrosial Arbor...

children.speaker: Alarmed Cloud Knight
children.line: Shut it, rambling rodent. The Cloud Knights will root all of you out soon.

text: What did you do to these Cloud Knights?

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: What did we do? We cured our kin! Hehe, it must hurt to be trapped in such weak flesh and blood...

children.speaker: Alarmed Cloud Knight
children.line: You scum... If the order allowed I would cut you down now.

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: Oh, you don't understand... a short-life species couldn't understand. Mara-struck? Bah! It's a second life gifted by Sanctus Medicus! To eliminate the self! To achieve transcendence! A life of true freedom!

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: I see a desire for power in your eyes. This life is too short for you, isn't it? Hehe, I can... I can help you...

children.speaker: Alarmed Cloud Knight
children.line: Don't listen, his words are poison.

children.speaker: Captured Disciple
children.line: We're just having fun, sir, hehe... Without the blessing of the Abundance, you short-life species would never be able to endure the transformation.

text: I don't have any more questions.
There is a ghastly paleness in the face of this resident Cloud Knight. As you approach him, he nods his head in salute.

speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
line: Forgive me for being brief — warfare is a dangerous business. There's no time for idle chat.

children.speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
children.line: We took over this place a few hours ago under the master diviner's command. It was only afterwards that we learned our enemies were none other than the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus — those who worship the Plagues Author .

speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
line: Everything was going as planned. The sorcerers of the Disciples and the fantastic creatures they commanded were no match for us.

speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
line: ...Then, after a while, our comrades suddenly started to slaughter one another...

children.speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
children.line: Curse it! What Sanctus Medicus sorcery did they use on us!?

children.speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
children.line: Yes, among the Sanctus Medicus monsters... there were our comrades.

text: (If Injured Cloud Knight was already helped in the previous step, this option will not appear)
There's a wounded warrior that didn't make it back to his unit...

children.speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
children.line: Thanks for your intel. I'll dispatch someone immediately.

speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
line: The greatest fear of the Xianzhou people is succumbing to our mara-struck form around others. To do so means that we have given up on being human, lost to the abomination sleeping in our immortal blood... and violated the Reignbow's admonishments.

speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
line: What the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus did are despicable acts that every Alliance resident detests!

speaker: On-Duty Cloud Knight
line: ...I swear to the Arbiter that I will avenge my comrades.

speaker: (If Adventure MissionVenom Brews, Immortality LoomsorSinners Misled, Credence Falsifiedare incomplete)

title: Step Description
content: The master diviner soon returns to the encampment. According to her, the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus have summoned bizarre abominations and used sorcery to disturb people's minds, making the Knights unable to push forward.She has figured out the reason but require the help of short-life individuals like you to overcome it.

title: Step Description
content: Deep in the bowels of the Alchemy Commission, the ancient elixir crucibles have been reactivated, and smoke bellows from them. This area was once named Evemist Mansion due to the mist generated by the elixir crucibles. Now these mists have been poisoned by the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, and can quickly induce mara in long-life species.However, as short-life individuals led here by theStellaron Hunters, you happen to be the indispensable help that Fu Xuan desperately needs.

title: Step Description
content: Deep in the bowels of the Alchemy Commission, the ancient elixir crucibles have been reactivated and smoke wafts out from them. This area was once named Evemist Mansion due to the mist generated by the elixir crucibles. Now these mists have been poisoned by the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, and can quickly induce mara in long-life species.Since you are the only ones who can break through the stalemate, you don't have a reason to refuse. You immediately prepare to fight the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus after turning off the elixir crucibles.

title: Mission Description
content: In a sudden turn of events, the master primus of the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus calls out on the brink of death for the one who brought the Stellaron to her, the assistant from the Antimatter Legion. Then, the guide who had been beside you all this time, "Miss Tingyun," suddenly turns into a ball of flame in a terrifying fashion, declaring to you their true identity of Phantylia, the Lord Ravager.Phantylia uses the Legion's soldiers to block your path while moving deeper into Scalegorge Waterscape to claim the source of the Xianzhou natives' immortality — the Ambrosial Arbor.
